oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The rain is angry with us, if we talk to a maiden against her wish. (L V.20. 5608-5612). An account of what the angry rain (or the 'water's !kabbe') does when the new maiden curses the people and snaps her fingers at her parents. 1) p.5607v: Dia!kwain heard this story from his mother (=kamme-an) and says that Jan Ronebout's mother (!kwarra-an) knows it too, 2) See also The maiden who snaps her fingers at the rain, 3) This story is found in Book V-20.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The girl who snaps her fingers at her parents and the rain
